It can be revocable by the owner. It is designed to be deployed behind a proxy by a VestingFactory. It inherits from EmergencyAwareBase to be compliant with the system's emergency protocols.","errors":{"NotAContract(string)":[{"details":"Thrown when an address is expected to be a contract but is an checkEmergencyStatus(bytes4).details: This function is typically called by modifiers within the implementing contract to guard functions.

params.operation: The 4-byte function selector of the operation being attempted.

returns.allowed: A boolean indicating if the operation is permitted.

constructor.details: Disables the regular constructor to make the contract upgradeable.

emergencyShutdown(uint8).details: The implementing contract defines how it should react to different emergency levels. For example, it might pause itself or enable emergency withdrawals.

params.emergencyLevel: The system-wide emergency level being broadcast by the controller.

returns.successFlag: A boolean indicating if the shutdown was handled successfully.

returns.revocableOut: True if the schedule is revocable.
returns.revokedOut: True if the schedule has been revoked.
returns.totalAmountOut: The total amount in the schedule.

params.beneficiary: The address that will receive the vested tokens.
params.cliffDuration: The duration in seconds during which no tokens are vested.
params.duration: The total duration of the vesting period.
params.initialOwner: The address that owns and can revoke the vesting schedule.
params.revocable: A flag indicating if the vesting can be revoked.
params.startTime: The timestamp when the vesting period begins.
params.tokenAddress: The address of the ERC20 token to be vested.
params.totalAmount: The total amount of tokens to be vested.

params.beneficiary: The address that will receive the vested tokens.
params.cliffDuration: The duration in seconds during which no tokens are vested.
params.duration: The total duration of the vesting period.
params.emergencyControllerAddress: The address of the system's EmergencyController.
params.initialOwner: The address that owns and can revoke the vesting schedule.
params.oracleIntegrationAddress: The address of the system's OracleIntegration contract.
params.revocable: A flag indicating if the vesting can be revoked.
params.startTime: The timestamp when the vesting period begins.
params.tokenAddress: The address of the ERC20 token to be vested.
params.totalAmount: The total amount of tokens to be vested.

returns.isPausedStatus: A boolean indicating if the contract is considered to be in a paused state.

returns.releasable: The amount of tokens available for release.

returns.amountReleased: The amount of tokens successfully released.

revoke().details: Any unvested tokens are returned to the owner. Any vested but unreleased tokens are sent to the beneficiary.

returns.amountRefundedToOwner: The amount of unvested tokens refunded to the owner.

setEmergencyController(address).details: This function should be access-controlled within the implementing contract (e.g., `onlyOwner`).

params.controller: The address of the new EmergencyController.

returns.successFlag: A boolean indicating if the operation was successful.

params.oracleAddr: The address of the new OracleIntegration contract.

returns.successFlag: A boolean indicating if the operation was successful.

params.newOwner: The address of the new owner.

returns.successFlag: A boolean indicating if the operation was successful.

returns.vested: The total vested amount at the given timestamp.

checkEmergencyStatus(bytes4).notice: Checks if a specific operation is allowed based on the current emergency status.

emergencyController().notice: The central controller for system-wide emergency states.

emergencyShutdown(uint8).notice: A function to be called by the EmergencyController to trigger a state change in the contract.

getEmergencyController().notice: Returns the address of the EmergencyController managing this contract.

getFactoryAddress().notice: Gets the address of the factory that created this vesting contract.

getTokenAddress().notice: Gets the address of the vested token.

getVestingSchedule().notice: Retrieves all details of the vesting schedule.

initialize(address,address,uint256,uint2.notice: Initializes the vesting contract without emergency or oracle integration.
Initializes the vesting contract with full emergency and oracle integration.

isEmergencyPaused().notice: Checks if the contract is effectively paused, either locally or by the global EmergencyController.

oracleIntegration().notice: The contract that provides reliable price feeds (optional).

owner().notice: Returns the owner of the vesting schedule.

releasableAmount().notice: Calculates the amount of tokens that are currently vested but not yet released.

release().notice: Allows the beneficiary to release their currently vested and unreleased tokens.

revoke().notice: Allows the owner to revoke the vesting schedule.

setEmergencyController(address).notice: Sets or updates the address of the EmergencyController.

transferOwnership(address).notice: Transfers ownership of the vesting contract to a new address.

vestedAmount(uint256).notice: Calculates the total amount of tokens that should have vested at a specific point in time.
